preprocessing.instance_selection

Class HMScore

  • java.lang.Object
    • preprocessing.instance_selection.InstanceSelector
      • preprocessing.instance_selection.HMScore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Citable, NSFUserInterface

    public class HMScore
extends InstanceSelector
implements NSFUserInterface
    This class implements the instance selection method based on calculating the HM score in Hit-Miss networks, as proposed in the paper titled 'Class Conditional Nearest Neighbor and Large Margin Instance Selection' by E. Marchiori that was published in IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence in 2010. The method was proposed for 1-NN classification but this implementation makes it possible to apply the method for kNN classification with k > 1 as well. Whether that is always appropriate or not remains to be seen, but it gives the users the option for experimentation.

      • HMScore

        public HMScore(DataSet dset,
       float[][] distMat,
       int kHM)
        Initialization.
        Parameters:
        dset - DataSet to reduce.
        distMat - float[][] that is the upper triangular distance matrix on the data.
        kHM - Integer that is the neighborhood size to use for generating the hit-miss network.

    • Method Detail

      • setInclusionPermissions

        public void setInclusionPermissions(boolean permitNoChangeInclusions)
        Parameters:
        permitNoChangeInclusions - Boolean flag indicating whether to consider elements for incremental inclusion when they have no visible negative or positive effect or to stop the process when such an element is reached. If set to false, a very small number of prototypes is selected. If set to true, a much lower error is achieved.

      • setNumThreads

        public void setNumThreads(int numThreads)
        Parameters:
        numThreads - Integer that is the number of threads to use in parts of the code where multi-threading is supported.

      • noRecalcs

        public void noRecalcs()
        Description copied from interface: NSFUserInterface
        Indicating that the object is shared and no recalculations can be done on it for synchronization purposes. An empty implementation is appropriate in methods that do not modify the NeighborSetFinder object's content.
        Specified by:
        noRecalcs in interface NSFUserInterface

      • calculatePrototypeHubness

        public void calculatePrototypeHubness(int k)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: InstanceSelector
        Calculates the neighbor occurrence profiles of the selected prototypes. This is meant to be overridden in those subclasses which use NSF-s (already have a kNN graph) - as this is slower, it assumes no previous neighbor information.
        Overrides:
        calculatePrototypeHubness in class InstanceSelector
        Parameters:
        k - Neighborhood size to be used in hubness calculations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
